intro: Astragalus irkeschtamii, commonly known as the Irkeshtam milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Astragalus irkeschtamii is known for its deep root system, which helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
